Title: [Container Management][Schedule Validation]Verify that User can create valid base schedule across 3 locations successfully
Description: Create and validate base schedule with auto-propagation across 3 locations
Precondition: A job has Location 1 (L1), Location 2 (L2), and Location 3 (L3). Time units in minutes.
Steps: 1. Open Container Management job with L1, L2, L3 locations; 2. Set L1 Required arrival to 08:00 and Tasks duration to 30 minutes; 3. Set Transit time from L1 to L2 to 20 minutes; 4. Set L2 Tasks duration to 20 minutes; 5. Set Transit time from L2 to L3 to 25 minutes; 6. Set L3 Tasks duration to 15 minutes; 7. Verify all auto-calculated times are correct
Expected Result: 1. Job opens with three location tabs visible; 2. L1 Required leave auto-calculates to 08:30; 3. L2 Required arrival auto-calculates to 08:50; 4. L2 Required leave auto-calculates to 09:10; 5. L3 Required arrival auto-calculates to 09:35; 6. L3 Required leave auto-calculates to 09:50; 7. All times reflect correct calculations with positioning times within windows
Actual Result: Leave 08:30; Transit L1→L2: 20 min; L2: Auto arrival 08:50
column16: Leave 09:10; Transit L2→L3: 25 min; L3: Auto arrival 09:35

Title: [Container Management][Auto-Propagation]Verify that User can change L1 Required leave and verify auto-propagation to L2/L3 successfully
Description: Test auto-propagation when L1 Required leave is modified
Precondition: An existing valid base schedule (see CM-3L-HR-001)
Steps: 1. Update L1 Tasks duration to 45 minutes; 2. Verify L2 Required arrival becomes 09:05; 3. Verify L2 Required leave becomes 09:25; 4. Verify L3 Required arrival becomes 09:50; 5. Verify L3 Required leave becomes 10:05; 6. Check positioning times auto-shift; 7. Confirm all constraints are preserved
Expected Result: 1. L1 Required leave moves from 08:30 to 08:45; 2. L2 Required arrival auto-calculates to 09:05 (L1 leave + 20 min transit); 3. L2 Required leave auto-calculates to 09:25 (arrival + 20 min duration); 4. L3 Required arrival auto-calculates to 09:50 (L2 leave + 25 min transit); 5. L3 Required leave auto-calculates to 10:05 (arrival + 15 min duration); 6. Positioning times automatically shift within valid windows; 7. All downstream times auto-adjust using duration and transit calculations
Test Data: Increase L1 Duration: 30→45 min; Transit L1→L2: 20 min; L2 Duration: 20 min; Transit L2→L3: 25 min; L3 Duration: 15 min

Title: [Container Management][Auto-Propagation]Verify that User can change L2 and verify auto-propagation to L3 successfully
Description: Test auto-propagation when L2 Tasks duration is modified
Steps: 1. Update L2 Tasks duration to 40 minutes; 2. Verify L2 Required leave is recalculated; 3. Verify L3 Required arrival equals L2 leave plus transit time; 4. Verify L3 Required leave equals arrival plus duration; 5. Check positioning time at L3 remains valid; 6. Confirm no constraint violations occur; 7. Validate all auto-calculations are accurate
Expected Result: 1. L2 Tasks duration changes from 20 to 40 minutes; 2. L2 Required leave recalculates to arrival + 40 minutes; 3. L3 Required arrival equals L2 Required leave + 25 min transit; 4. L3 Required leave equals L3 arrival + 15 min duration; 5. Positioning time at L3 remains within Required arrival/leave window; 6. No constraint violations are detected; 7. All L3 times auto-adjust correctly from L2 changes
Test Data: Modify L2 Duration: 20→40 min; Transit L2→L3: 25 min; L3 Duration: 15 min

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can prevent Required leave earlier than Required arrival for each location successfully
Description: Test system validation preventing invalid time configurations
Steps: 1. Set L2 Required arrival to 09:00; 2. Attempt to set L2 Required leave to 08:55; 3. Try calendar selection method; 4. Try manual typing method; 5. Observe system response; 6. Check field clearing behavior; 7. Verify schedule cannot be saved
Expected Result: 1. L2 Required arrival is set to 09:00 successfully; 2. System blocks setting Required leave to 08:55; 3. Calendar picker disables invalid time selection; 4. Manual typing shows validation error message; 5. System displays 'Entered time cannot be applied. Please enter a valid time'; 6. Invalid field is cleared automatically; 7. Schedule cannot be saved in invalid state
Test Data: Attempt at L2: Required arrival 09:00 and Required leave 08:55

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can prevent L2 Required arrival earlier than L1 Required leave successfully
Description: Test system validation preventing downstream time violations
Precondition: Valid L1 Required leave exists; same for L2
Steps: 1. Set L1 Required leave to 08:45; 2. Try L2 Required arrival at 08:40; 3. Set L2 Required leave to 09:30; 4. Try L3 Required arrival at 09:20; 5. Observe calendar blocking behavior; 6. Test manual typing validation; 7. Verify system prevents invalid configurations
Expected Result: 1. L1 Required leave is set to 08:45 successfully; 2. System blocks L2 Required arrival at 08:40 (before L1 leave); 3. L2 Required leave is set to 09:30 successfully; 4. System blocks L3 Required arrival at 09:20 (before L2 leave); 5. Calendar selections are blocked for invalid times; 6. Manual typing shows notification and clears field; 7. System prevents all downstream time violations
Test Data: Try L2 Required arrival < L1 Required leave; Try L3 Required arrival < L2 Required leave

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can ensure Positioning time is within each location's Required arrival and Required leave successfully
Description: Test positioning time validation within location time windows
Steps: 1. Attempt to set L2 Positioning time to 09:30 (out of range); 2. Set L2 Positioning time to 09:10 (in range); 3. Verify out-of-range rejection; 4. Verify in-range acceptance; 5. Check system validation messages; 6. Confirm field behavior differences; 7. Validate constraint enforcement
Expected Result: 1. L2 Positioning time 09:30 is blocked (outside 09:05-09:25 window); 2. L2 Positioning time 09:10 is accepted (within valid range); 3. Out-of-range time shows rejection notification; 4. In-range time is accepted without issues; 5. System displays appropriate validation messages; 6. Invalid fields are cleared, valid fields are saved; 7. All positioning time constraints are properly enforced
Folder: Required leave 09:25; attempt Positioning time 09:30 (out of range) and 09:10 (in range)

Title: [Container Management][Auto-Propagation]Verify that User can change L2 Required arrival and verify downstream and local recalculations successfully
Description: Test auto-propagation when L2 Required arrival is modified
Steps: 1. Set L2 Required arrival to 09:00; 2. Verify L2 Required leave equals arrival plus duration; 3. Verify L3 Required arrival equals L2 leave plus transit time; 4. Verify L3 Required leave equals arrival plus duration; 5. Check positioning times re-align; 6. Confirm all constraints are preserved; 7. Validate complete downstream recalculation
Expected Result: 1. L2 Required arrival is set to 09:00 successfully; 2. L2 Required leave equals 09:30 (09:00 + 30 min duration); 3. L3 Required arrival equals 09:55 (09:30 + 25 min transit); 4. L3 Required leave equals 10:10 (09:55 + 15 min duration); 5. Positioning times automatically re-align within new windows; 6. All time constraints remain valid; 7. System recalculates L2 leave and all L3 times automatically
Test Data: Adjust L2 Required arrival to 09:00; L2 Duration: 30 min; Transit L2→L3: 25 min; L3 Duration: 15 min

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can prevent L3 timings from forcing invalid earlier times in L2/L1 successfully
Description: Test system protection against upstream time violations
Steps: 1. Try setting L3 Required arrival earlier than L2 Required leave; 2. Attempt to edit Transit L2→L3 time; 3. Attempt to edit L3 Required arrival directly; 4. Observe system blocking behavior; 5. Check upstream location validity; 6. Verify no changes to earlier locations; 7. Confirm constraint protection
Expected Result: 1. System blocks L3 Required arrival earlier than L2 Required leave; 2. Transit L2→L3 editing is prevented if it would cause violations; 3. Direct L3 Required arrival editing is blocked for invalid times; 4. System prevents all invalid time configurations; 5. Earlier locations (L1, L2) remain valid and unchanged; 6. No modifications are allowed that would break upstream constraints; 7. System maintains complete constraint protection across all locations
Test Data: Attempt to edit L3 to set Required arrival earlier than L2 Required leave

Title: [Container Management][Auto-Propagation]Verify that User can perform sequential edits and verify all cascaded recalculations successfully
Description: Test multiple sequential changes with cascading auto-propagation
Steps: 1. Increase L1 Tasks duration by 10 minutes; 2. Confirm L2 Required arrival auto-shifts; 3. Increase L2 Tasks duration by 10 minutes; 4. Confirm L3 Required arrival/leave auto-shifts; 5. Verify positioning times remain valid; 6. Check all downstream calculations; 7. Validate complete system reflow
Expected Result: 1. L1 Tasks duration increases by 10 minutes successfully; 2. L2 Required arrival auto-shifts from L1 Required leave + transit time; 3. L2 Tasks duration increases by 10 minutes successfully; 4. L3 Required arrival/leave auto-shifts accordingly; 5. All positioning times remain within valid ranges; 6. All downstream times reflow after each change; 7. Complete system maintains validity after sequential edits
Test Data: Increase L1 Duration by 10 min; then increase L2 Duration by 10 min; Transit times unchanged

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can reject typed out-of-range values successfully
Description: Test system rejection of manually typed invalid values
Steps: 1. Type L2 Required arrival earlier than L1 Required leave; 2. Type positioning time outside valid window; 3. Observe system notification display; 4. Check field clearing behavior; 5. Verify validation message accuracy; 6. Confirm schedule save prevention; 7. Validate complete error handling
Expected Result: 1. System shows 'Entered time cannot be applied. Please enter a valid time' message; 2. Invalid positioning time triggers same validation message; 3. System displays clear error notification for each violation; 4. Invalid fields are automatically cleared; 5. Validation message accurately describes the issue; 6. Schedule cannot be saved with invalid values; 7. Complete error handling prevents invalid data entry
Test Data: Type L2 Required arrival earlier than L1 Required leave; type Positioning time outside L2 Required arrival/leave window

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can block ineligible times and dates across L1, L2, L3 successfully
Description: Test calendar picker blocking of invalid time selections
Steps: 1. Open calendar pickers for L1, L2, L3; 2. Try to select times that violate constraints; 3. Observe disabled option behavior; 4. Check for validation messages; 5. Verify picker functionality; 6. Confirm constraint enforcement; 7. Validate user experience
Expected Result: 1. Calendar pickers open successfully for all locations; 2. Invalid time options are properly disabled; 3. Disabled options are visually distinct and unselectable; 4. No validation messages are shown for disabled options; 5. Picker functionality works correctly for valid times; 6. All time constraints are properly enforced; 7. User experience is clear and intuitive
Test Data: Attempt to select times that violate constraints via calendar pickers for L1

Title: [Container Management][Persistence]Verify that User can save after auto-propagation and reload to verify persisted values successfully
Description: Test persistence of auto-calculated values after save and reload
Precondition: Any scenario where times were auto-updated
Steps: 1. Make a change that triggers auto-propagation; 2. Save the job; 3. Reload the job; 4. Verify auto-calculated values persist; 5. Check for data drift; 6. Confirm no reversion occurs; 7. Validate complete persistence
Expected Result: 1. Auto-propagation change is made successfully; 2. Job saves without errors; 3. Job reloads completely; 4. All auto-calculated values persist exactly as calculated; 5. No data drift is detected; 6. No values revert to previous states; 7. Complete persistence of all auto-calculated data is confirmed

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can handle wrong date/time handling for picker vs typing successfully
Description: Test different validation behaviors for picker vs manual entry
Precondition: Valid schedule exists for L1, L2, L3
Steps: 1. Open L2 Required arrival field; 2. Select invalid time 08:30 via picker; 3. Type invalid time 08:30 manually; 4. Observe picker behavior; 5. Observe typing behavior; 6. Compare notification messages; 7. Validate field state differences
Expected Result: 1. L2 Required arrival field opens successfully; 2. Picker shows notification and field reverts to previous valid value; 3. Manual typing shows same notification and field is cleared; 4. Picker method reverts to last valid value; 5. Typing method clears the field completely; 6. Both methods show identical notification messages; 7. Field states differ appropriately for each input method

Title: [Container Management][Validation]Verify that User can enforce strict boundary requirements successfully
Description: Test system enforcement of minimum time gap requirements
Precondition: L1, L2 exist with valid schedules
Steps: 1. Attempt equality for L2 Required arrival vs L1 Required leave; 2. Attempt equality for each location's Required leave vs Required arrival; 3. Set +1 second difference for valid configurations; 4. Test picker behavior for equal times; 5. Test typing behavior for equal times; 6. Verify +1 second acceptance; 7. Validate complete boundary enforcement
Expected Result: 1. Equality is not allowed for L2 arrival vs L1 leave; 2. Equality is not allowed for any location's leave vs arrival; 3. +1 second difference configurations are accepted; 4. Picker disables equal time selections; 5. Typing equal times shows error and clears field; 6. +1 second difference values are accepted and saved; 7. Complete boundary enforcement prevents all invalid configurations
Test Data: L2 Required arrival = L1 Required leave (equal – invalid); L2 Required arrival = L1 Required leave + 1 second (valid); Each location: Required leave = Required arrival (equal – invalid); Required leave = Required arrival + 1 second (valid)

Title: [Container Management][Persistence]Verify that User can save and reload persistence after auto-propagation successfully
Description: Test persistence of auto-calculated values after save and reload operations
Steps: 1. Make a change that triggers auto-propagation; 2. Save the job; 3. Reload the job; 4. Verify auto-calculated times persist; 5. Check for any data drift; 6. Confirm no reversion occurs; 7. Validate complete data integrity
Expected Result: 1. Auto-propagation change is made successfully; 2. Job saves without errors; 3. Job reloads completely; 4. All auto-calculated times persist exactly as calculated; 5. No data drift is detected; 6. No values revert to previous states; 7. Complete data integrity is maintained after save and reload
